skill.name: market-research-reports
skill.description: Generate comprehensive market research reports (50+ pages) in the style of top consulting firms (McKinsey, BCG, Gartner). Features professional LaTeX formatting, extensive visual generation with scientific-schematics and generate-image, deep integration with research-lookup for data gathering, and multi-framework strategic analysis including Porter Five Forces, PESTLE, SWOT, TAM/SAM/SOM, and BCG Matrix.

content.value_statement: An AI skill for Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive 50+ page market research reports in consulting firm style (McKinsey, BCG, Bain, Gartner)
Create professional LaTeX-formatted documents with the market_research.sty style package
Generate 5-6 essential visual diagrams using scientific-schematics (market growth charts, TAM/SAM/SOM, Porter's Five Forces, risk heatmaps, competitive matrices)
Create executive summary infographics and cover page imagery using generate-image
Apply multiple strategic frameworks: Porter's Five Forces, PESTLE, SWOT, BCG Matrix, TAM/SAM/SOM analysis
Integrate with research-lookup for gathering market size data, competitive intelligence, and industry trends
Produce structured reports covering market overview, competitive landscape, and strategic recommendations
Generate implementation roadmaps, investment thesis sections, and actionable strategic recommendations
limitations: Requires research-lookup skill for market data gathering - cannot function as a standalone research tool
Requires scientific-schematics skill for diagram generation and generate-image for infographics
Report compilation requires a LaTeX distribution (xelatex, bibtex) installed on the system
Visual generation can be time-consuming and may require multiple iterations for optimal quality
Comprehensive reports require significant time to research, generate visuals, and write content
Output quality depends heavily on the quality and recency of data gathered from research-lookup

use_cases.title: Market Entry Analysis
use_cases.description: Analyze a target market for entry opportunities including TAM/SAM/SOM sizing, competitive landscape assessment, and risk evaluation
use_cases.target_user: Business strategists and product managers evaluating new market opportunities

use_cases.title: Investment Due Diligence
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive market analysis for investment decisions with market sizing, growth projections, competitive positioning, and risk assessment
use_cases.target_user: Investment analysts, private equity firms, and venture capitalists

use_cases.title: Strategic Planning Support
use_cases.description: Develop industry analysis reports for internal strategic planning with competitive intelligence, trend analysis, and actionable recommendations
use_cases.target_user: Corporate strategy teams and executive leadership

use_cases.title: Competitive Intelligence Reports
use_cases.description: Generate detailed competitive landscape analyses including Porter's Five Forces, market share breakdown, and strategic group mapping
use_cases.target_user: Market researchers and competitive intelligence professionals

prompt_templates.title: Market Overview Section
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a comprehensive market overview section for the {MARKET_NAME} market. Include: clear market definition and scope, industry ecosystem with key stakeholders, value chain analysis, historical evolution, and current market dynamics. Generate 2 supporting visuals using scientific-schematics: market ecosystem diagram and industry structure diagram.
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating the opening chapter of a market research report

prompt_templates.title: Competitive Landscape Section
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the competitive landscape for the {MARKET_NAME} market. Include: Porter's Five Forces analysis with High/Medium/Low ratings for each force, top 10 competitors with market share percentages, competitive positioning matrix, strategic group mapping, and barriers to entry. Generate 4 supporting visuals: Porter's Five Forces diagram, market share chart, positioning matrix, and strategic group map.

prompt_templates.title: Strategic Recommendations Section
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop strategic recommendations for entering the {MARKET_NAME} market. Include: 5-7 prioritized recommendations with opportunity sizing, implementation considerations, risk factors and mitigations, and success criteria. Generate 3 supporting visuals: opportunity attractiveness matrix, priority framework, and implementation timeline.
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating the final strategic recommendations chapter

output_examples.input: Generate a comprehensive market research report for the renewable energy storage market.
output: Executive summary with key findings and investment thesis
Market overview with ecosystem mapping and stakeholder analysis
Market growth trajectory chart (2020-2034) showing 15.3% CAGR
Porter's Five Forces diagram with competitive intensity ratings
Competitive positioning matrix with top 8 competitors
PESTLE analysis covering political, economic, social, technological, legal, and environmental factors
Risk heatmap with 10 key risks rated by probability and impact
Appendices with methodology, data tables, and company profiles

best_practices: Generate all 5-6 core visuals before writing begins to establish report structure and narrative flow
Use research-lookup extensively to gather current market data, competitor information, and industry trends before writing
Apply strategic frameworks systematically - Porter's Five Forces, PESTLE, SWOT - with clear ratings and rationale
Cite all statistics and data points with specific sources (Gartner, IDC, industry reports, company filings)
Include 5-7 actionable recommendations that are specific, prioritized, and include implementation considerations
Ensure report meets minimum 50-page target by expanding data tables, regional breakdowns, and company profiles
anti_patterns: Generating reports without first conducting thorough research - data quality suffers without proper data gathering
Skipping visual generation - market research reports should include 5-6 essential diagrams for key frameworks
Applying frameworks incompletely - Porter's Five Forces should rate all five forces, SWOT should address all four quadrants
Making claims without citing sources - all market statistics and projections need specific attribution
Submitting reports without quality review - check for orphaned figures, incomplete sections, and formatting errors

faq.question: What does the market-research-reports skill do?
faq.answer: This skill generates comprehensive 50+ page market research reports in the professional style of top consulting firms (McKinsey, BCG, Bain, Gartner). It creates LaTeX-formatted documents with professional typography, generates essential visual diagrams using scientific-schematics and generate-image, applies strategic analysis frameworks (Porter's Five Forces, PESTLE, SWOT, TAM/SAM/SOM), and produces actionable recommendations with implementation roadmaps.

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: The skill requires Read, Write, Edit, and Bash tools for file operations and LaTeX compilation. For full functionality, it also requires integration with research-lookup (for market data gathering), scientific-schematics (for diagram generation), and generate-image (for infographics). A LaTeX distribution (xelatex, bibtex) is needed to compile the final PDF.

faq.question: How long does it take to generate a complete report?
faq.answer: A comprehensive 50+ page market research report typically requires 2-4 hours of work including: research and data gathering (30-60 minutes), visual generation (30-60 minutes for 5-6 core diagrams), and report writing (60-90 minutes). The actual time depends on market complexity, data availability, and visual generation requirements.

faq.question: What strategic frameworks does this skill apply?
faq.answer: The skill applies multiple established strategic frameworks including: Porter's Five Forces (industry attractiveness), PESTLE (macro-environmental factors), SWOT (internal/external analysis), BCG Matrix (portfolio analysis), TAM/SAM/SOM (market sizing), Risk Heatmap (risk prioritization), and various competitive positioning matrices. Each framework includes structured analysis with ratings and strategic implications.

faq.question: What makes a high-quality market research report from this skill?
faq.answer: A high-quality report demonstrates: comprehensive coverage (50+ pages), data-driven insights with sourced statistics, 5-6 well-designed visual diagrams, systematic framework application, actionable recommendations with prioritization, and professional LaTeX formatting. Quality indicators include: all sections complete, no orphaned figures, bibliography with proper citations, and PDF that compiles without errors.
